Dear Tyler Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the Program Manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.

Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

License #: CI330201171
Licensee Group Organization: Highfields, Inc.
Licensee Designee: Brian Douglas Philson
Chief Administrator: Tyler LAMONT Jones
Agency Name: Highfields
Agency Address: 5123 Old Plank Rd
Onondaga, MI 49264-9707

License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2024
Capacity: 36

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/12/23, youth and staff member were in an argument in the
school room. Youth walked into the refocus room to settle down
and staff member followed youth. Staff member pulled youth by
his hair and slammed him on the floor, resulting in a busted and
bleeding lip.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/14/2023 this investigation was initiated via telephone
contact with DHHS specialist and Residential Coordinator. The
DHHS specialist made an on-site visit to the agency to verify
wellbeing of Youth A and to interview Residential Coordinator
(RC). I participated via telephone. RC advised that Staff 1 had
been moved to a different house and was not having contact with
Youth A. She also advised that Operations Manager (OM) had
completed conflict resolution with both Youth A and Staff 1. RC
described the incident as “horseplay”. The DHHS specialist
requested confirmation of safety plan with additional measures
and RC agreed. The plan included Staff 1 not being alone with
other youth, that he refrain from involvement in physical
management of youth (unless emergency) and refrain from
transporting youth. We were advised that Youth A had been
transported to the Emergency Department for assessment. RC
further advised that she had not viewed the video until now and
stated she had concerns with the actions of the staff in the video.
RC reported that she felt it was appropriate for Staff 1 to continue
to work with other youth, despite what was seen on the video.
The DHHS specialist expressed her overall concern.
On 12/15/2023 an on-site visit occurred at Highfields. DHHS
specialist and Detective were also present for interviews. We
were advised that the Chief Administrator remains out sick. An in-
person interview was held with RC. She advised that she first was
aware of the incident when she came to work on Wednesday
morning. Once aware she reported that she contacted the CA
and he informed her that she needed to contact DCWL. RC
2

stated she had concerns, but did not feel like Staff 1 intended to
harm Youth A. She went on to share that Staff 1 has never had
any disciplinary action since working for the agency. RC recalled
that OM and CA made the decision to only relocate Staff 1 to
another house on the campus.
On 12/15/2023 an on-site interview was completed with Staff 3.
DHHS specialist and Detective were also present for interview.
Staff 3 is a family counselor and has worked for the agency for 10
years. Staff 3 was aware of the incident and stated he first heard
about it around 8pm on the day that it occurred. He stated he
received calls from other staff. OM also contacted Staff 3 and
advised that Youth A reported being assaulted by a staff. He
stated he did not have additional information but proceeded to
contact the mother of Youth A to advise that he had been in an
altercation. He also reported calling CA, who was already aware
of the incident. He recalled arriving at work the next day at 7:30
am, reviewed the video and spoke with Youth A. He reported that
Youth A advised that he and Staff 1 were “going back and forth” in
the classroom and that Staff 1 made threats to his family. He
stated that Youth A went to resource room to calm down and
refocus but stated Staff 1 followed and they began to wrestle each
other. He reported seeing Youth A the day after the incident
occurred and he did not seem to be in any distress, nor observe
any injuries. Staff 3 reported that Youth A stated he did not
initially report the issue because it “wasn’t an issue”. After
watching the video, Staff 3 stated he assessed that both Staff 1
and Youth A were being aggressive, and he did not see it as
appropriate behavior by a staff member.
On 12/15/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Office
Manager (OM) at Highfields. DHHS specialist and Detective were
also present for interview. OM has been employed with the
agency for 18 years. He stated he first became aware of incident
on the night it happened at 9pm. He was contacted by Staff 4,
who had overheard Youth A tell his mother during a phone call
that he was assaulted. OM stated he advised Staff 4 to watch the
video and provide an update. Staff 4 called and advised OM that
there was an altercation between Staff 1 and Youth A that seemed
like wrestling but was serious. OM advised that he was sent
snippets of the video to his phone to review and described it as
“inappropriate”. OM also referred to the actions in the video as
“horseplay” during the interview at some point, but later clarified
that horseplay is not appropriate between staff and youth. OM
reported that he spoke to the CA on that night and was advised to
begin the separation of Staff 1 from Youth A for the next
3

scheduled shifts. OM reported that he watched the video in its
entirety around 11am on Wednesday morning. He reported that
he spoke with Youth A after watching the video and was advised
that it started in the classroom and Staff 1 was talking to Youth A
about the need for positive role models and referenced his dad
being incarcerated. It escalated into a war of words and Youth A
reported making insults toward Staff 1 also. OM reported that as
soon as he watched the video he knew it was inappropriate, but
did not suspect it to be abuse or neglect and therefore did not
report it as such. OM stated that nothing about the incident was
“appropriate” and that no part of what occurred is within the
training guidelines. OM stated that he can’t justify the actions
taken by Staff 1 and as professionals, they should not ever be
putting their hands on kids like that. DHHS specialist expressed
some concern regarding the assessed lack of appropriate
response or actions taken by Highfield staff. OM replied that there
was some difficulty in the response due to CA being out sick and
not onsite.
On 12/21/2023 DHHS specialist and I spoke with OM again at
Highfields. OM allowed review of snippets of video on his
personal cell phone that was forwarded to him the night of the
event. There were four in total and they varied in length. He was
sent the snippets by Staff 4. It was confirmed that the snippets
that were sent clearly documented the altercation between Youth
A and Staff 1.
On 12/15/2023 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at his residential home. DHHS specialist and Detective were
also present for interview. The mother advised of her intent to
record the interview and opted not to leave the room while Youth
A was being interviewed. DCWL and DHHS management team
was contacted for consultation on the issue and were advised to
proceed. Youth A reported that he and Staff 1 were going back
and forth in a hostile way in the classroom and he was pulled into
the refocus room by Staff 2. He reported that Staff 1 shortly came
in. Youth A reported Staff 1 pulled his hair, slammed him to the
ground and slammed him on the table causing him to hurt his
back. Youth A reported that later in the evening he asked to
contact his mother via telephone after telling Staff 5 what
happened. He recalls the incident happened in the morning and
he advised staff in the evening. He reported that his lip was
bleeding and his back hurting after the incident. Youth A
confirmed that Staff 2 was also in the room, made an attempt to
intervene into the situation, but neither he nor Staff 1 was
4

listening. Youth A reports he was taken to the hospital, was
released and did not require any treatment.
On 12/21/2023 a scheduled in-person meeting was to occur with
Staff 1 at Highfields. DHHS specialist, Detective and myself were
present. Staff 1 did not attend and sent message via CA that he
was COVID positive and would not be attending in person.
Attempt to have him join via Teams was also unsuccessful.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person meeting was held with CA at
Highfields. DHHS specialist was also present. CA reported that
he was contacted the night of 12/12 while home sick with COVID.
He was contacted by OM and advised that Youth A reported being
assaulted and then called his mother on the phone. CA reported
he first watched the video on Wednesday or Thursday morning.
He referred to what he saw as a “wrestling match” and added that
he was not sure what Staff 1 was thinking at the time. He
admitted to having a range of thoughts regarding the video;
including thinking that Staff 1 and Youth A were hugging. CA
indicated that the behavior he viewed on the video is not what is
taught to staff and is not condoned. CA stated the decision made
to move Staff 1 to another unit and allow him to continue to work
is a “typical” response to notification of a concern. He confirmed
that he made that decision and stated he was doing the best he
could while home sick. CA advised that OM and RC were also
apart of the decision that was made. CA advised that it has also
been decided to terminate Staff 1 and a notice had been prepared
yesterday. CA was advised of the concern by DCWL of what was
assessed as a lack of action and disregard for continued risk of
harm to youth by allowing Staff 1 to continue to provide care to
youth pending the investigation. CA advised that had he been
working and not home sick, that he would have made a different
decision. He denied seeing the video from home but confirmed
that he advised the staff in charge of the need to contact DCWL.
CA confirmed knowledge that Staff 2 or Staff 1 failed to notify
centralized intake of possible abuse or neglect. CA advised that
Staff 1 would be terminated and not allowed back on site of the
facility.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Highfields. DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2 has been
employed with the agency since 2018. Staff 2 confirmed that she
was in the classroom with Staff 1 and Youth A. She recalls that
they were talking about something with each other, and Youth A
became upset. She recalls that there were a total of 6 youth in the
room, with two staff and the teacher. Staff 2 reported hearing
5

Youth A say “I don’t care, I’ll shoot your grandma and shoot your
brother” and then heard Staff 1 say “oh, for real”. She then asked
Youth A to step into the resource room, which he did. As they
were passing, Youth A said something to Staff 1 about his wife.
Youth A advised Staff 2 that Staff 1 wasn’t going to be talking to
him in a crazy manner. After being in the refocus room for about 3
to 4 minutes, Staff 1 reported Staff 2 knocked on the door of the
refocus room and Youth A let him in and got into a fighting stance
and asked Staff 1 “what’s good”? Staff 1 responded asking Youth
A if this is what he really wanted to do, took his hoodie off, and
initiated wrestling with Youth A. Staff 2 stated she thought it was
horseplaying at first, but then noticed that Youth A got mad. She
reported she tried to get in between the two and get them to stop
without any success. She denied she made any attempt to call for
assistance or backup. Staff 2 recalled she thought it was
unnecessary for Staff 1 to come into the room. She denied any
injuries for Youth A and he advised her he was ok. She reported
that she completed the incident report the next day. She did not
report any observed injures to Youth A. Staff 2 confirmed with
both her and Staff 1 absent from the room, there was no other
staff supervising the remaining youth. Staff 2 denied ever hearing
Youth A tell Staff 2 to stop or leave him alone. She reported she
believed Staff 1 came to the refocus room to prove a point to
Youth A. She denied that Youth A was punched. She also denied
the table in the refocus room was broken but recalled Youth A and
Staff 1 slammed into it. Staff 2 reiterated that she attempted to
intervene with a firm voice but did not call for other staff
assistance.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Teacher 1 at
Highfields. The DHHS specialist was also present. Teacher 1 is
an employee of Ingham County ISD and has been assigned to
Highfields for five years. She recalled that the students were
having free time and she overheard Youth A and Staff 1 begin to
get into a verbal argument. She was unsure what they were
arguing about. She asked Youth A to calm down and said he was
then taken to the refocus room by Staff 2. She confirmed Staff 1
also left the room and there was no staff remaining to meet
agency required ratio. She recalled that Youth A returned to the
classroom right before lunch and he and Staff 1 sat next to each
other. She denied that he had any visible injuries. She recalled
inquiring with Staff 2 about what was going on and Staff 2
responded that Youth A was upset with Staff 1 because he called
him spoiled and not a real criminal. Teacher 1 reported Youth A
and Staff 1 usually get along well and she did not recall a time
6

when Staff 1 had been inappropriate with Youth A or any other
youth.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at
Highfields. The DHHS specialist and Detective were also present.
Youth B is familiar with Staff 1 and described him as cool and that
he helps out a lot with school and other things. He denied he has
ever felt unself around Staff 1 or at the agency. He also denied
seeing anything inappropriate happen at school. He recalled
being in class on the day of the incident and heard Staff 1 talking
about the dad of Youth A and Youth A got mad. He recalled that
Youth A went to the refocus room and when he went to the
bathroom, he could see Youth A in the refocus room punching the
walls. He also reported hearing noise, such as banging on the
wall, coming from the resource room.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Highfields. The DHHS specialist and Detective were also present.
He reported he is placed at Lett’s house and confirmed Staff 1 is
assigned to Lett’s house. He described Staff 1 as cool and nice
and denied feeling unsafe around him. He reported that all youth
are cool with Staff 1. He confirmed he was in the classroom but
was unsure of what was going on. He recalled being in the
bathroom for most of the time and denied specific knowledge of
the event.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth D at
Highfields. The DHHS specialist and Detective were also present.
Youth D reported he resides in Lett’s House and Staff 1 is a staff
there. He described Staff 1 as funny, nice and gets along with all
youth. He denied ever seeing anything inappropriate since being
placed at Highfields. Youth D recalled being in the classroom on
the day of the incident. He recalled Youth A was talking about the
family of Staff 1 and this led to a verbal altercation between the
two. He further stated they went to the refocus room and he
heard what he thought was “bumping on the wall” and heard Staff
2 saying “stop”. He recalled Staff 1 came back from the refocus
room and said “I almost beat the shit out of your boy”, meaning
Youth A.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 5 at
Highfields. DHHS specialist was also present. He reported
around 3:45pm Youth A was in the house and looked as if he was
upset. Staff 5 reported Youth A was in his room with his head
down and crying. He was refusing to respond to requests asking
if he is okay. On the third attempt, Youth A advised Staff 5 that he
7

and Staff 1 had “got into it” and were arguing back and forth. He
stated the argument was about a local rapper that happened to be
the uncle of Youth A.
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at
Highfields. DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 4 reported he
has been employed by the agency for five years and is currently a
direct service supervisor. Staff 4 reported he was advised of the
incident when he was called by Staff 5 and asked to come to the
youths house. Upon arrival, Staff 5 told him Youth A stated Staff 1
had beat him up during school in the resource room. Staff 4
stated he watched the video and thought that it did not look good.
He reported he had concerns regarding the way Staff 1 took off
his shirt and postured up toward Youth A. He also was concerned
with seeing Staff 1 wrestle with Youth A, pin him to the ground,
holding him down by his hair, putting him in a headlock and put his
knee in the back of Youth A. Staff 4 reported he did see Staff 2
attempt to break them up. Staff 4 called OM and told him what he
saw on the video. Staff 4 sent OM a few short clips of the video
via text message. Staff 4 reported he had no further involvement
in the incident since that time. He noted what he saw on the video
is not in line with what staff should be doing with youth at the
facility.
On 12/21/2023 a telephone call was made to complainant. There
were no additional concerns noted.
On 01/05/2024 a video conference was held with Staff 1. DHHS
specialist was also present. He confirmed that he has been
employed at Highfields since July 2023. He is assigned as the
personal advocate for Youth A and reported he worked with him
regularly. He also said he knew Youth A prior to working at
Highfields and he had advised his supervisor of this. Staff 1
recalled on the day of the incident, Youth A seemed to be having
a bad day. He was cursing in class and attempts to redirect him,
by both Staff 1 and Staff 2, had not been successful. Per Staff 1,
Youth A went to the refocus room after being asked to leave the
classroom by the teacher and Staff 2 followed. Staff 1 reported he
went to the resource room to check on things after being asked by
the teacher what was going on with Youth A. Staff 1 denied there
was any verbal exchange between him and Youth A in the
classroom and denied that they were discussing anything or
anyone. Staff 1 did report he advised Youth A that he looks up to
the wrong people and his family is leading him down the wrong
path. Upon reaching the resource room, Staff 1 said he stated to
Youth A “we can do this,” wrapped him up in a wrestling hold and
8

they began to wrestle. Staff 1 stated afterwards Youth A told him
he was stressed about going to Ingham Academy as there were
students there that have threatened him. Staff 1 reported after
OM reviewed the video, he was advised it wasn’t child abuse, but
aggressive horseplay. Staff 1 stated he agrees it was aggressive
horseplay. He also confirmed he was aware that only one staff
was required to be in the refocus room and ratio was not
maintained when he left the classroom. Staff 1 admitted his
actions were not consistent with agency policy, however noted
that his intentions were not malicious, and he did not want to hurt
Youth A. He stated he and Staff 2 discussed the incident and did
not want Youth A to lose any points, so they did not report it. Staff
1 lastly reported that when he arrived for work the next day the
incident was discussed briefly and he was assigned to a different
youth house than where Youth A was placed. Staff 1 failed to
indicate who he had a discussion with prior to being assigned to a
different house.
On 01/08/2024 an exit conference was held via video conference
with me, DHHS Specialist and CA. The DHHS specialist advised
of the findings of her report and preliminary DCWL findings were
provided.
On 01/09/2024 a Pre-Disposition conference was held via video
conference. The DHHS specialist and her supervisor, DCWL area
manager and I participated. DHHS specialist provided findings
relevant to her investigation and preliminary findings for the DCWL
investigation were provided. DHHS reported a confirmed case for
physical injury as Youth A suffered a scratch to his nose, small cut
to his mouth and back pain from the incident.
Review of Video Footage 12/12/23 – Youth A and Staff 2 are
seen in the refocus room together. Staff 1 comes in and takes an
aggressive stance in front of Youth A then removes his shirt. Staff
1 is seen physically engaging with Youth A; grabbing him around
the neck, swinging him around toward the wall, pinning his back to
the wall, flipping him over, holding him to the ground and forcing
his face down onto a table. Staff 2 is seen attempting to intervene
by getting in between Youth A and Staff 1 on several occasions,
without success. Staff 2 is seen removing the hand of Staff 1 from
the hair of Youth A. Staff 1 leaves the refocus room but returns
within 1 minute later. Upon return, Staff 1 picks up items he had
previously dropped while fighting with Youth A. He then shakes
hands with Youth A. They sit together briefly and appear to be
engaged in conversation.
9

Document Review:
On 12/14/2023 an email correspondence was received from
DHHS specialist. She provided an update and advised that after
expression of concerns and further discussion with administration,
RC reported that Staff 1 has been suspended and removed from
the schedule at this time.
On 12/27/2023 an email correspondence was received from
Detective; DHHS specialist was also copied on the email. She
provided a copy of her report and advised she would be
forwarding to the prosecutor for review. As of 01/09/2024 the
charges were still being reviewed.
Review of Policies and Procedures: The House Guidelines
Policy was reviewed and documented the following:
• Horesplay which includes rough housing, wrestling, or
excessive touching between students or staff and students
is not allowed.
• The policy forbids: Corporal punishment in any form and
verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation including negative
references to youth's background.
• In relation to the refocus room it documented it should be
used by the school when a student is being disruptive or
agitated by the group. Students should always remain
under the supervision of at least one staff.
• The policy also indicated a critical incident report is to be
completed immediately after any incident but always within
12 hours of the incident.
Review of Incident Report – Incident report (IR) was reviewed. It
indicated the date of the incident was 12/13/2023 at 1:35 pm and
documented witnesses as Staff 1 and Staff 2. The IR was
completed by Staff 2 and signed by RC. In summary, the incident
report reflected that Staff 1 and Youth A exchanged words in the
classroom and was asked to go to the refocus room. Staff 2 was
in the refocus room with Youth A when Staff 1 came in and
positioned himself in a fighting stance. The IR further indicated
that they began to wrestle and horseplay and both fell to the
ground. Staff 2 attempted to intervene with no success. They
began to wrestle again and Youth A grew more upset. They
continued to wrestle and at the end had a conversation in the
refocus room and established therapeutic rapport.
The report indicates Youth A received a small bruise to his lip, but
medical attention was not required. Parents were contacted within
24 hours.
10

Review of Employee File – information in employee file
documented that Staff 1 had criminal history that included a felony
charge and conviction.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in noncompliance with licensing rule 4158 due to Staff 1 engaging
in horseplay and using physical activity with Youth A. Review of
video footage and interviews with youth and staff confirmed that
non-compliance with the rules occurred.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR#: 2023C0000338 CAP Approved 5/23/2023
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section Rule 127. (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a
Description written staff-to-resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to maintain staff to youth ratio as identified in their
policy.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/21/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Teacher 1 at
Highfields. The DHHS specialist was also present. Teacher 1 is
an employee of Ingham County ISD and has been assigned to
Highfields for five years. She confirmed that Staff 1 left the room
and there was no staff remaining to meet agency required ratio.
Teacher 1 confirmed that she is not included in the staff to youth
ratio.
On 01/05/2024 a video conference was held with Staff 1. DHHS
specialist was also present. Per Staff 1, Youth A went to the
refocus room after being asked to leave the classroom by the
teacher and Staff 2 followed. Staff 1 reported he went to the
resource room to check on things after being asked by the teacher
what was going on with Youth A. He confirmed that no staff
remained in the classroom. There were a total of 6 youth in the
classroom.
Document Review:
A review of the agency Behavior Management Philosophy and
Procedures policy was completed and documented that agency
staffing ratio is one to six during waking hours.
11

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4127. The staff did not
maintain staff to youth ratio as required per their policy and left a
teacher who is not employed by the facility alone with the youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to follow written policy regarding completion of
incident reports.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/21/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Highfields. DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2 has been
employed with the agency since 2018. Staff 2 confirmed she was
present in the classroom with Staff 1 and Youth A prior to the
incident. She reported she completed the incident report the next
day.
Document Review:
A review of the IR was completed. It was noted that it was
completed by Staff 2 and was not consistent with actions seen on
the video. It was also completed over 24 hours after the incident.
A review of the agency’s Behavior Management Philosophy and
Procedures policy was completed. Incident Reporting policy of
the agency indicates IR’s are to be completed immediately after
any incident, but always within 12 hours of the incident.
Analysis The agency was found to be in non-compliance with licensing rule
4109-1-C. Agency failed to follow their written policy regarding the
completion of incident reports.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description
12

(2) A person who has unsupervised contact with children shall not
have been convicted of either of the following: (b) A felony
involving harm or threatened harm to an individual within the 10
years immediately preceding the date of hire.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency hired a staff person with a felony conviction within ten
years of hire and with an active warrant for his arrest.
Investigation The HR file of Staff 1 was reviewed. The file included criminal
history results that documented his prior charge and conviction of
a felony charge.
A current criminal history check documented that Staff 1 had an
active warrant. It was also noted the warrant had been pending
since before his employment with Highfields.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4112-2-b. The agency hired
an employed with an active warrant and felony conviction within
the last year.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency staff failed to report suspected abuse and neglect.
Investigation During the course of the investigation, several Highfields staff
were interviewed. This included OM, RC, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3,
Staff 4, Staff 5 and CA. All staff are mandated reporters and
confirmed for me during interviews that they failed to contact
DHHS – Centralized intake to report suspected abuse and
neglect.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, it was found that the agency
was in non-compliance with licensing rule 4131. After witnessing
the incident firsthand and watching video of the incident, none of
the staff reported the incident as required by the child protection
law.
13

Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be modified to a First provisional
license.
